translation: Indifference to the objects of the senses and also absence of egoism; perceiving the evil in birth, death, old age, sickness, and pain.
commentary: 13.9 In senseobjects? Vairagyam dispassion? Anahankarah absence of egoism? Eve even? f and? Birth, death, old age, disease, suffering, evil, perception of evil in birth? old age? sickness and pain.Commentary The feeling of renunciation towards the objects of the senses is constant in the man of wisdom. He doesn't even like to talk about them. His senses do not run towards them.Vairagyam Indifference
